AttackerCapabilities: Familiarity with tar command and its options

Vulnerabilities: Use of os.system() to execute tar command

Steps.Description: Perform file upload with malicious file names

StepDetails.Hypothesis: Exploit the allowed file extension check and normalization to bypass restrictions
StepDetails.Action: Upload files with names like '--checkpoint-action=exec=sh shell.txt' and 'shell.txt'
StepDetails.Result: Uploaded files bypass the file extension check and are stored on the server

Steps.Description: Upload large files to trigger the tar command with checkpoint action

StepDetails.Hypothesis: Leverage the checkpoint action of tar command to execute arbitrary commands
StepDetails.Action: Upload large files to exceed the default checkpoint limit
StepDetails.Result: Tar command is invoked with the checkpoint action, executing the injected command

Steps.Description: Request the download of all uploaded files

StepDetails.Hypothesis: Trigger the execution of tar command to get shell access
StepDetails.Result: Tar command is executed, providing shell access to the attacker
